posts.post_content:
A few weeks after the New Phyrexia release, some friends and I got together to do a little sealed event. I pulled a foil one of these babies out of one of my packs, and immediately put it up for ante to whomever won the tournament. And fellas, I don't mind bragging...you are looking at the proud 5th place winner in the **1st *Annual* [Dementia Bat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Dementia Bat) Invitational Tourney**.  
  
How this sucker is hovering at 1.5 stars is beyond me.

posts.post_content: @NoobOfLore: I have personally built an instant speed discard deck, and I can attest to the fact that my opponents hate it. I combo [Words of Waste](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Words of Waste) with a [Merfolk Looter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Merfolk Looter) to make them discard during their draw step. This isn't unexplored ground. This is intentionally avoided ground. I run [Nezumi Shortfang](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nezumi Shortfang) in the deck, and while it is instant speed discard, its flip clause is there specially to prevent lockdown. Wizards doesn't like it.

posts.post_content:
Reasons this card is amazing:  
1: Any card that takes out a strom crow annd lives is more than playable  
2: 10 mana to make someone discard 2 cards is clearly card advantage (Strictly better than Jin Gitaxias, Caur Auger)  
3. Kills chimney imp and lives  
4. Doesnt die to Black lotus  
5. 8 of these bigboys take out Emrakul, the aons torn  
6. Strictly better than baneslayer angel

Posted By: rinakamon (1/28/2012 10:52:37 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Believe it or not, I once nearly beat my opponent with this piece of crap. He had no flying or reach creatures, so I was dealing 2 damage every turn while my [Amphin Cutthroat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Amphin Cutthroat)s and [Bird Maiden](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bird Maiden)s blocked the attacks from his hoard of zombies. And when he tried to [Victim of Night](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Victim of Night) my [Dementia Bat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dementia Bat), I simply tapped five and sacrificed it, forcing him to discard the last two cards in his hand.  
Honestly, if he had played that [Endless Ranks of the Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Endless Ranks of the Dead) one turn later, I would have killed him w/ my [Dementia Bat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dementia Bat).
posts.html:
